content.description:
Sit start with a left hand crimp and a right hand bump on the arete. From there,  crank up to a right hand sidepull, then begin traversing left along the lip to the boulder's apex, and mantle on top.

First move gives the problem its difficulty, as the traverse cruises the well featured lip. The rock is solid, but it's not entirely vetted, be conscious of how and what you're pulling on.
content.protection: A pair of pads work well enough. The problem climbs over a very good landing, but there is a rock near the end of the problem.
content.location: It traverses the south lip of Pink.

content.description:
Pentimento climbs a slightly overhung arete on solid rock over a decent landing.

Sit start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand sidepull. From there, crank up and slap a left hand on the arete, then work the face crimps and features on the arete to reach an easy mantle.

The quality of the flake before the top out is questionable. Be careful cranking on it.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing has a rock below it, but it pads well.
content.location: It climbs the southwest arete of Pink.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand gaston and a right hand next to it on a pinch-sidepull-undercling. From there, bump the left hand up to an uneven seam, move to a right hand sidepull, tip toe the feet into place, stick the good diagonal shelf with the right hand, then finish straight up through the tree branch for an easy mantle.
content.protection: Pair of pads will be fine. The landing is near perfect, but there is a tree branch behind the landing.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Pink.
